title: What breathing exercise can improve memory and mental associations, and why is it important to use the whole foot while walking?
first_phrase: In the previous text, we learned about the importance of walking using the whole foot and not just the heels. This helps to improve stability, balance, and overall tonicity of the body. In addition, we can further enhance mental exercises by incorporating a breathing exercise that develops memory and creates mental associations. The exercise involves sitting in a relaxed yet upright position and bending the torso while breathing in and saying a phrase such as "the breath is life". The following 200 tokens describe a variation of the exercise where one focuses on the tip of the nose while breathing.
